intro: Pentacalia tunamensis, commonly known as the Tunamensis Milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves, which are typically oval in shape. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple in color. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
